name: Client
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Client
description:
Client

A client is used to create table data client instance with or without app profile id to read and/or modify data in a Cloud Bigtable table.

See Google::Cloud::Bigtable::Project#client.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

client = bigtable.client("my-instance")

table = client.table("my-table")
entry = table.new_mutation_entry("user-1")
entry.set_cell(
  "cf-1",
  "field-1",
  "XYZ"
  timestamp: Time.now.to_i * 1000 # Time stamp in milli seconds.
).delete_from_column("cf2", "field02")

table.mutate_row(entry)

returns.description: The unique identifier for the instance.

methods.name: table
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Client#table
methods.description: Get table instance to perform read/write data operations.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

client = bigtable.client "my-instance"

table = client.table("my-table")

examples.caption: With app profile
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

client = bigtable.client "my-instance"

table = client.table("my-table", app_profile_id: "my-app-profile")

params.name: table_id
params.description: The unique identifier for the table. Required.

params.name: app_profile_id
params.description:
The unique identifier for the app profile. Optional.
This value specifies routing for replication. If not specified, the
“default” application profile will be used.
